headline: Hormel Turkey Sale Refocuses Portfolio As Valuation Signals Potential Upside
summary: Hormel Foods (NYSE:HRL) has agreed to sell its whole bird turkey business to Life-Science Innovations. The deal includes production facilities and transportation assets tied to the whole bird segment. The Jennie O brand and its broader product range are not part of the sale. The transaction is expected to close by the end of the second quarter of fiscal 2026, subject to customary conditions. Hormel Foods, trading at $24.48, has seen mixed share performance, with a 4.7% gain year to date but...

headline: Ground Beef Hits Record $6.67 As US Cattle Herd Shrinks To 1951 Levels
summary: U.S. inflation eased to 2.4% in January 2026, but ground beef hit a record $6.67 per pound, up 20.5% year over year, as cattle inventory fell to 85 million, the lowest level since 1951.

raw.headline: Ground Beef Hits Record $6.67 As US Cattle Herd Shrinks To 1951 Levels

headline: How HRL Is Reshaping Its Portfolio to Support Long-Term Growth
summary: Hormel Foods is reshaping its portfolio with a strategic divestiture to boost profitability and focus on value-added protein offerings.

raw.headline: How HRL Is Reshaping Its Portfolio to Support Long-Term Growth
raw.summary: Hormel Foods is reshaping its portfolio with a strategic divestiture to boost profitability and focus on value-added protein offerings.

headline: Hormel to sell off Thanksgiving turkey assets
summary: The Jennie-O owner is divesting its whole bird business to Life-Science Innovations as it focuses more on deli meat and value-added products.

raw.headline: Hormel to sell off Thanksgiving turkey assets
raw.summary: The Jennie-O owner is divesting its whole bird business to Life-Science Innovations as it focuses more on deli meat and value-added products.
